meanings.definition: The state or condition of being an alien.
meanings.sent1: Living in an alienage can be challenging for newcomers.
meanings.sent2: The government granted him alienage after he moved to the new country.
meanings.sent3: The alienage was bustling with different languages and cultures.
meanings.sent4: Her alienage in the foreign land made her feel like a visitor in her own life.
meanings.sent5: The alienage was a vibrant mix of traditions and customs.

meanings.definition: The status of being an alien.
meanings.sent1: His alienage was evident from his unique accent.
meanings.sent2: She had to prove her alienage to gain citizenship.
meanings.sent3: In the alienage, he stood out with his peculiar fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: The alienage of the visitors was clear from their confusion at the customs.
meanings.sent5: The alienage of the outsiders was respected by the locals.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being an alien.
meanings.sent1: The alienage of the creatures was evident in their strange appearance.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the alienage of her heritage with pride.
meanings.sent3: The alienage of the new student made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: The alienage of the plants in the garden gave it an otherworldly feel.
meanings.sent5: The alienage of the spaceship made it stand out among the ordinary aircraft.
